title: Automated Call Service: Outlook CRM and Calendar Field Mapping
security_notes: No credentials or PII. Field schema only.

sections.heading: Overview
sections.raw_markdown:
This document defines all Outlook-based CRM and Calendar fields that the automated call service agent reads and writes.
It supports integrations through Microsoft 365 and Outlook APIs for contact management, categories, and event scheduling.

The mapping ensures consistent handling of contacts, sales states, estimate scheduling, and follow ups using Outlook Categories,
Contacts, and Calendar Events.

System of Record
Outlook is the CRM of record for this deployment. The agent reads Outlook Contacts first, then writes updates and schedules via Outlook APIs. Funnel states are enforced via Outlook Categories (see Sales Category Mapping).

sections.heading: Outlook Contact Fields
sections.path: CRM and Integration Schema (Outlook) > Outlook Contact Fields
sections.raw_markdown:
| Field Name | Outlook Object | Type | Direction | Description | Required | Default/Fallback |
|-------------|----------------|------|------------|--------------|-----------|-----------------|
| contact_id | Contact | string | read/write | Unique contact identifier in Outlook | yes | create new if missing |
| givenName | Contact | string | read/write | First name of caller | yes | ask if unclear |
| surname | Contact | string | read/write | Last name of caller | yes | none |
| businessPhones | Contact | array | read/write | Primary business or mobile number | yes | collect verbally |
| emailAddresses | Contact | array | read/write | Primary or secondary email | optional | none |
| homeAddress | Contact | object | read/write | Job or service address | yes | ask before scheduling |
| companyName | Contact | string | write | Caller company or organization | optional | none |
| businessHomePage | Contact | string | write | Optional website or referral source | optional | call_automation |
| categories | Contact | array | write | Mirrors Outlook Category (Sales funnel state) | yes | New |
| jobTitle | Contact | string | write | Used internally for service type or role | optional | inferred from context |
| notes | Contact | text | write | Summary of conversation or estimate scope | yes | generated by agent |

Notes
- categories must match the allowed funnel states exactly: New, Qualified, Estimating, Booked, Closed Lost.
- When setting categories, the agent should not write synonyms or free text; only the exact values above.

sections.heading: Outlook Calendar Fields
sections.path: CRM and Integration Schema (Outlook) > Outlook Calendar Fields
sections.raw_markdown:
| Field Name | Outlook Object | Type | Direction | Description | Required | Default/Fallback |
|-------------|----------------|------|------------|--------------|-----------|-----------------|
| event_id | Event | string | read/write | Calendar event identifier | yes | generated automatically |
| subject | Event | string | write | Event title such as On Site Estimate | yes | On Site Estimate |
| start | Event | datetime | write | Start time of meeting | yes | confirmed during call |
| end | Event | datetime | write | End time of meeting | yes | 1 hour after start |
| location | Event | string | write | Service address or online link | yes | job address |
| attendees | Event | array | write | List of invitees (customer and estimator) | yes | caller plus assigned estimator |
| organizer | Event | string | write | Staff member or shared mailbox scheduling event | yes | default to business account |
| body | Event | text | write | Notes with estimate details or prep instructions | optional | summary from contact notes |
| categories | Event | array | write | Used for tagging by service type or priority | optional | inferred from service_type |
| timeZone | Event | string | write | Meeting time zone | yes | business default or detected |

Notes
- Default meeting duration is 1 hour (end = start + 1h) unless specified by the caller.
- Record the timezone explicitly; confirm if caller timezone differs from business timezone.

sections.heading: Sales Category Mapping (Outlook Categories)
sections.path: CRM and Integration Schema (Outlook) > Sales Category Mapping
sections.raw_markdown:
The Outlook Categories field represents the current sales state for each contact or opportunity.
These categories are color coded in Outlook and synchronized with CRM states.

| Category | Meaning | Trigger | Next Step |
|-----------|----------|----------|-----------|
| New | First contact captured by the agent | Caller identified and request recorded | Qualify lead |
| Qualified | Basic questions answered and location verified | Checklist complete | Move to Estimating |
| Estimating | On site visit scheduled or estimate in progress | Appointment created | Await acceptance |
| Booked | Service appointment confirmed | Estimate accepted | Schedule work |
| Closed Lost | Prospect declined or unresponsive | No response after 30 days after two nudges | Archive contact |

Notes
- Nudge cadence: two follow-ups spaced 24 hours apart before starting the 30-day no-response timer.

sections.heading: Data Validation and Fallbacks
sections.path: CRM and Integration Schema (Outlook) > Data Validation and Fallbacks
sections.raw_markdown:
1. Normalize phone numbers by removing spaces and punctuation before lookup.
2. If Outlook Contact creation fails, retry after refreshing OAuth token.
3. Ensure Category values match one of the predefined sales states.
4. Calendar creation requires both start and end times; default duration is 1 hour.
5. On time zone mismatch, default to the business calendar's time zone.
6. Verify that the organizer field matches a valid business mailbox before writing.
7. Confirm caller timezone when scheduling; write the event with the correct timezone recorded.
8. Enforce the funnel category whitelist exactly: New, Qualified, Estimating, Booked, Closed Lost.
